title: **Small RNA extraction**
body: ●TIMING 1 h

| Prepare RNA from fresh or cry preserved tissue or cells \(or cell lines) with the use of a mirVana miRNA isolation kit, following the manufacturer’s instructions and using the small-RNA fraction option, which allows purification of small RNA molecules of 200 nt.  A 50 μl volume is obtained.
| Precipitate the RNA from the 50 μl volume of sample obtained in

body.title: Step 1
body.body: by adding 2.5 μl of 5 M NaCl and 150 μl ethanol, keep it on dry ice for 30 min, centrifuge it at 14,000 g for 20 min at 4 °C, discard the supernatant and rinse the precipitate with 80 % ethanol before allowing it to air dry.  Dissolve the RNA precipitate in 5 μl DEPC water.  If the yield of RNA is thought to be >0.5 μg, determine the RNA concentration by measurement of absorbance at 260 nm.  If the concentration of RNA is >1μg μl–1, then it should be adjusted to 1μg μl–1 with DEPC water.

title: **▲CRITICAL STEP**
body: Precipitation of a small amount of small RNAs requires that the volume of the solution be small.

title: **■PAUSE POINT**
body: The RNA solution can be stored at –80 °C for several weeks.
